clase: centro, medio, inverso, título-deslizamiento

```{r, eval=F, echo=F, include=F}
# Must do in order to render.

pacman::p_load(xaringan)
devtools::install_github("gadenbuie/xaringanExtra")
devtools::install_github("gadenbuie/countdown")
remotes::install_github("mitchelloharawild/icons")
icons::download_fontawesome()

# Render with xaringan::infinite_moon_reader()
# Slides will appear in viewer, and will update as you edit/save
```

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, 
                      warning = FALSE, 
                      message = FALSE, 
                      fig.retina = 3  ## retina more effective than w/h (according to twitter)
                      # fig.width = 16, 
                      # fig.height = 10
                      )
## I dont know why this is included in the example xaringan slide 
## but is something to do with background images
options(htmltools.dir.version = FALSE)

## install and load necessary packages 
pacman::p_load(
  rio,        # importing data  
  here,       # relative file pathways  
  janitor,    # data cleaning and tables
  lubridate,  # working with dates
  tidyverse,  # data management and visualization
  gtsummary,  # summary tables
  flair,      # coloring text
  kableExtra, # for output tables
  xaringanthemer  # for styling presentation 
)

library(countdown)
```

```{r xaringan-themer, include=FALSE}

## define presentation colours (theme) using {xaringanthemer} package 
## https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/xaringanthemer/articles/xaringanthemer.html

## epirhandbook logo colours: 
  ## blue: "#00538c"
  ## green: "#007732"
  ## lighter green: "#48a878"

## see ?style_mono_accent for all the things can customise
style_mono_accent(
  base_color = "#00538c", 
  link_color = "#48a878", 
  # add logo to the title page (bit bigger)
  title_slide_background_image = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/appliedepi/slides/master/images/logo.png",
  title_slide_background_position = "95% 95%",
  title_slide_background_size = "25%",
  ## add logo to all following slides
  background_image = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/appliedepi/slides/master/images/logo.png", 
  background_size = "10%",
  background_position = "100% 0%"
)
```

```{r, echo=F, eval=T}

googlesheets4::gs4_deauth()

gen <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(
  "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-Xqv5xvakmhKSxipVP6a9GF3H54RN-rbilhdNhPHx6M/edit#gid=998182281",
  range = "generic") %>%
  clean_names()

mod1 <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(
  "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-Xqv5xvakmhKSxipVP6a9GF3H54RN-rbilhdNhPHx6M/edit#gid=998182281",
  range = "mod1", col_types = "c") %>%
  clean_names()
```

???

- R puede leer y escribir en montones de programas y bases de datos diferentes.
- Puede contener varios conjuntos de datos a la vez

- Flujos de trabajo automatizados y reproducibles (te ahorran tiempo y quebraderos de cabeza)

# `r paste0(mod1[mod1$uid == "mod1_h1_popularity", params$lang])`

.centro\[

```{r, eval=TRUE, echo=FALSE, out.width="65%"}
# Using here() alone won't work because Rmd folder becomes the rendering root.
# adding xfun::relative_path() creates a dynamic file path between the Rmd location and the here() path.
# It dynamically creates the ../../etc filepath.

#knitr::include_graphics(xfun::relative_path(here::here("images", "welcome", "r_popularity.png")))


knitr::include_graphics(xfun::relative_path(here::here("images", "welcome", paste0("R_popularity_", params$lang, ".png"))))
```

\]

???

- R es gratis - y sin embargo puede hacer más de lo que puede hacer un costoso software con licencia
- Antes estaba limitado a los estadísticos académicos: R no era "de confianza".
- Pero ahora incluso las empresas farmacéuticas (p. ej. GSK) y los organismos reguladores están haciendo el cambio
- Es el lenguaje de programación estadística más utilizado.
